jserver
Class JClientManager

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      jserver.JClientManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class JClientManager
extends java.lang.Thread

This stores and controls all the TCP clients. and handles sending messages to other clients.

Constructor Detail

JClientManager

public JClientManager(JServerForm form)
Initialise a new client manager. This stores and controls all the TCP clients. and handles sending messages to other clients.

Parameters:
form - a JServerForm used to add messages to the server GUI.

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(JClient c,
                        java.lang.String message)
sends a message to an individual client.

Parameters:
c - the JClient the message should be sent too.
message - a String containing the message to send.

sendMessageAll

public void sendMessageAll(java.lang.String message)
sends a message to every client on the server.

Parameters:
message - a String containing the message to send.

sendMessageOthers

public void sendMessageOthers(JClient sender,
                              java.lang.String message)
sends a message to every client except the person who sent the original message on the server.

Parameters:
sender - the JClient that sent the original message.
message - a String containing the message to send.

addClient

public void addClient(JClient newClient)
adds a client to the client manager. and sends a message to all other clients stating there connection. Also if a client already in the manager has the same name as the new client, the new client is renamed with the time as a prefix.

Parameters:
newClient - a new JClient.

removeClient

public void removeClient(JClient deadClient)
removes a client from the client loop. and sends a message to all other clients stating which client has left.

Parameters:
sender - the JClient that sent the original message.
message - a String containing the message to send.
